sections.title: Further reading

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: The section contains citations which require verification by reliable sources.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Each entry in the 'Further reading' section includes a well-formatted citation with a DOI and PMID.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section adheres completely to the requirement by providing reliable and specific sources.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: This section is distinct in content and does not overlap with other parts of the article.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: The section uses citation templates like Cite journal, ensuring standardization.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: All citations use the 'Cite journal' template.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Complete adherence by using citation templates, enhancing consistency and clarity.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: No overlap with other citation practices detected.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Having consistent citation format improves readability and professionalism of the section.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Citations follow a uniform format using 'Cite journal'.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: There is complete adherence to format consistency within this section.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: Citations format is consistent throughout the section.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Providing access to free content increases transparency and user engagement.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: One citation includes a DOI link marked as 'free access'.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Mostly adheres but can improve by ensuring every freely available text has a clear URL.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: DOI and free access links reduce redundancy by directly pointing to resources.

sections.meta_notes: The 'Further reading' section is well-structured with comprehensive citations, aligned with the best practices and standards for academic writing.
